t: Proverbs 15
Contrast the Upright and the Wicked
A*pn gentle answer turns away wrath, But*ln a harsh word stirs up anger.
The*ln tongue of the wise makes knowledge acceptable, But*ln the mouth of fools spouts folly.
The*ln eyes of the Lord*s are in every place, Watching*ln the evil and the good.
A*ln soothing tongue is a tree of life, But*ln perversion in it crushes the spirit.
A*ln fool rejects his fatherâ€™s discipline, But*ln he who regards reproof is sensible.
Great*ln wealth is in*i the house of the righteous, But*ln trouble is in the income of the wicked.
The*ln lips of the wise spread knowledge, But*ln the hearts of fools are not so.
The*ln sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the Lord,*s But*ln the prayer of the upright is His delight.
The*ln way of the wicked is an abomination to the Lord,*s But*ln He loves one who pursues righteousness.
Grievous*ln punishment is for him who forsakes the way; He*ln who hates reproof will die.
Sheol*ln and Abaddon lie*i open*i before the Lord,*s How*ln much more the hearts of men!
A*ln scoffer does not love one who reproves him, He*ln will not go to the wise.
A*ln joyful heart makes a cheerful face, But*ln when the heart is sad, the spirit is broken.
The*ln mind of the intelligent seeks knowledge, But*ln the mouth of fools feeds on folly.
All*ln the days of the afflicted are bad, But*ln a cheerful heart has*i a continual feast.
Better*ln is a little with the fear of the Lord*s Than*ln great treasure and turmoil with it.
Better*ln is a dish of vegetables where love is Than*ln a fattened ox served*i with hatred.
A*ln hot-tempered man stirs up strife, But*ln the slow to anger calms a dispute.
The*ln way of the lazy is as a hedge of thorns, But*ln the path of the upright is a highway.
A*ln wise son makes a father glad, But*ln a foolish man despises his mother.
Folly*ln is joy to him who lacks sense, But*ln a man of understanding walks straight.
Without*ln consultation, plans are frustrated, But*ln with many counselors they succeed.
A*ln man has joy in an apt answer, And*ln how delightful is a timely word!
The*ln path of life leads*i upward for the wise That*ln he may keep away from Sheol below.
The*ln Lord*s will tear down the house of the proud, But*ln He will establish the boundary of the widow.
Evil*ln plans are an abomination to the Lord,*s But*ln pleasant words are pure.
He*ln who profits illicitly troubles his own house, But*ln he who hates bribes will live.
The*ln heart of the righteous ponders how to answer, But*ln the mouth of the wicked pours out evil things.
The*ln Lord*s is far from the wicked, But*ln He hears the prayer of the righteous.
Bright*ln eyes gladden the heart; Good*ln news puts fat on the bones.
He*ln whose ear listens to the life-giving reproof Will*ln dwell among the wise.
He*ln who neglects discipline despises himself, But*ln he who listens to reproof acquires understanding.
The*ln fear of the Lord*s is the instruction for wisdom, And*ln before honor comes*i humility.
